excerpt: Fans curious about Cheryl Cole's net worth in 2024 and how much money she makes can read on to learn all the details.
siteName: ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More
text: Fans are curious about Cheryl Cole’s net worth in 2024. This curiosity happens right around the time, the story of her and late One Direction singer Liam Payne’s first meeting, made its way to the internet. Consequently, fans are eager to learn how Cole has amassed her wealth over the years. Here is what we have uncovered on Cheryl Cole’s net worth in 2024 and her sources of income. What is Cheryl Cole’s net worth in 2024? Cheryl Cole has an estimated net worth of $USD 40 million in 2024. Cole’s net worth in 2024 consists of earnings from her music career, and her work as a judge on X-Factor. Additionally, it includes her work as a popular television personality. Cheryl Cole is most famous for having been a member of the girl group Girls Aloud. This group originated via the TV talent show Popstars: The Rivals. Cole is also known for her work as a judge on X-Factor, where Liam Payne also auditioned once. What does Cheryl Cole do for a living? Cheryl Cole is a singer and television personality. Cole’s last studio album, Only Human, was released ten years ago in 2014. Furthermore, her last known single “Let You” came out five years earlier in 2019. Cole has also served as the judge for TV shows like The X Factor and The Greatest Dancer. Cheryl Cole’s earnings explained — how does she make money? Cheryl Cole earns money from her work as a singer and television personality. Music career Cole’s main source of income is her work as a musician, both as a solo artist and membership with Girls Aloud. With the pop music group, she produced the albums Sound of the Underground, What Will the Neighbours Say?, Chemistry, Tangled Up, and Out of Control. Girls Aloud had a total of 20 consecutive hit singles in the United Kingdom. As a solo artist, Cheryl Cole dropped multiple singles and albums like 3 Words, Messy Little Raindrops, Only Human, Call My Name, Crazy Stupid Love, and I Don’t Care. Judge of X-Factor Between 2008 and 2011 and 2014-16, Cheryl Cole served as a judge on the UK version of X-Factor. In 2011, she was briefly part of the US version of the series as well, but ended up leaving after three weeks. Cole eventually sued the producers of the US version of the series for $2.3 million after learning she was replaced, eventually winning the settlement with an undisclosed amount. Television personality Cheryl Cole has also appeared in several TV projects, like The Greatest Dancer, Michael McIntyre’s Big Show, and RuPaul’s Drag Race UK.
html:
Fans are curious about Cheryl Cole’s net worth in 2024. This curiosity happens right around the time, the story of her and late One Direction singer Liam Payne’s first meeting, made its way to the internet. Consequently, fans are eager to learn how Cole has amassed her wealth over the years.

Here is what we have uncovered on Cheryl Cole’s net worth in 2024 and her sources of income.

What is Cheryl Cole’s net worth in 2024?

Cheryl Cole has an estimated net worth of $USD 40 million in 2024.

Cole’s net worth in 2024 consists of earnings from her music career, and her work as a judge on X-Factor. Additionally, it includes her work as a popular television personality.

Cheryl Cole is most famous for having been a member of the girl group Girls Aloud. This group originated via the TV talent show Popstars: The Rivals. Cole is also known for her work as a judge on X-Factor, where Liam Payne also auditioned once.

What does Cheryl Cole do for a living?

Cheryl Cole is a singer and television personality.

Cole’s last studio album, Only Human, was released ten years ago in 2014. Furthermore, her last known single “Let You” came out five years earlier in 2019. Cole has also served as the judge for TV shows like The X Factor and The Greatest Dancer.

Cheryl Cole’s earnings explained — how does she make money?

Cheryl Cole earns money from her work as a singer and television personality.

Music career

Cole’s main source of income is her work as a musician, both as a solo artist and membership with Girls Aloud. With the pop music group, she produced the albums Sound of the Underground, What Will the Neighbours Say?, Chemistry, Tangled Up, and Out of Control. Girls Aloud had a total of 20 consecutive hit singles in the United Kingdom.

As a solo artist, Cheryl Cole dropped multiple singles and albums like 3 Words, Messy Little Raindrops, Only Human, Call My Name, Crazy Stupid Love, and I Don’t Care.

Judge of X-Factor

Between 2008 and 2011 and 2014-16, Cheryl Cole served as a judge on the UK version of X-Factor. In 2011, she was briefly part of the US version of the series as well, but ended up leaving after three weeks. Cole eventually sued the producers of the US version of the series for $2.3 million after learning she was replaced, eventually winning the settlement with an undisclosed amount.

Television personality

Cheryl Cole has also appeared in several TV projects, like The Greatest Dancer, Michael McIntyre’s Big Show, and RuPaul’s Drag Race UK.
